meanings.sent1: The collagenous tissue provided strength and support to the body.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the collagenous fibers under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The collagenous bandage wrapped around the injury looked like a tiny rope.
meanings.sent4: Her skin felt as collagenous as a spring mattress, smooth and firm.
meanings.sent5: The collagenous structure of the bone made it resilient to fractures.

meanings.sent1: The collagenous texture of the food reminded her of jelly.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the collagenous properties of the material.
meanings.sent3: The collagenous clouds in the sky seemed to be made of cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, so shiny and collagenous, caught the sunlight beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The collagenous appearance of the fabric made it durable and flexible.

meanings.sent1: The collagenous cells in the body helped in wound healing.
meanings.sent2: The specialized cells were responsible for the collagenous matrix formation.
meanings.sent3: The collagenous factory in the body never seemed to run out of material.
meanings.sent4: Her body worked like a collagenous factory, repairing tissues constantly.
meanings.sent5: The collagenous glands produced the protein essential for skin elasticity.
